abstract: June killing of unarmed black man by white police Officer Tyler Cook in Tupelo, Miss, is endangering city's reputation as racially progressive area; residents have become particularly polarized by accusations police dog attacked and mutilated groin of victim Antwun Shumpert before he was shot dead; Justice Dept and FBI are monitoring investigation of shooting, and Shumpert's family has filed $35 million civil rights lawsuit.

headline.print_headline: Black Man’s Shooting Recalls Southern Wounds
headline.main: Black Man’s Fatal Encounter With Police Splits Mississippi City Known for Harmony

snippet: After Antwun Shumpert was fatally shot by a police officer last month, Tupelo, Miss., has been thrust into a national debate....
lead_paragraph: After Antwun Shumpert was fatally shot by a police officer last month, Tupelo, Miss., has been thrust into a national debate.
